title: Literate programming with R Markdown
description:
Literate programming is a technique for meshing source code with a human-readable explanation of its
logic. This approach is used widely in data science and the social sciences to enable
reproducible research and open access. In this workshop, we introduce the R Markdown document format
and practice developing notebooks interweaving source code, output, and written text.

title: Geospatial visualizations with sf
description:
R contains many different packages for importing, structuring, and visualizing geospatial datasets.
A modern implementation, `sf`, uses the simple features format to encode spatial vector data. This
method integrates directly into tidy workflows and visualization method such as `ggplot2`.
In this workshop we will introduce the `sf` package and practice generating vector graphics for
geospatial data using `ggplot2`.

title: Optimizing selection of color palettes
description:
Researchers frequently use color to communicate numeric values in a data visualization.
Most software will implement a default algorithm to select a color palette, and these
palettes frequently are hard-to-interpret or are incompatible with common forms of color
blindness. In this workshop we will develop approaches to readily generate optimized
color palettes for continuous and categorical variables.

title: Data visualization with ggplot2
description: An introduction to data visualization and the grammar of graphics in R.
contents:
Data visualization with ggplot2
Overview
Data visualizations are an important tool for communicating scientific findings. Visualizations encode empirical data in a compact and efficient form to help tell a story using your data. This workshop provides an introduction to creating statistical graphics using R and the ggplot2 package.
Objectives
Produce scatter plots, boxplots, and barplots using ggplot2
Overlay multiple plot types on a single graph
Set universal plot settings
Describe faceting (or small multiples plots) and apply faceting in ggplot2
Modify the aesthetics of an existing ggplot() plot
Build complex and customized plots from data in a data frame
Audience
This workshop is designed for individuals with a basic familiarity using R and programmatic tools to conduct data analysis.
